location_short_descr: The Sloupsko-Šošůvské caves are the largest accessible caves in the Czech Republic. It consists of an extensive...
location_long_descr:
The Sloupsko-Šošůvské caves are the largest accessible caves in the Czech Republic. It consists of an extensive complex of domes, corridors and huge underground chasms that connect two underground floors with a height difference of 60 m. Tours include classic circuits or an experiential excursion to the lower floors.
The Sloup-Šošův Caves, located on the northern edge of the Moravian Karst near the town of Sloup, represent an extensive complex of houses, corridors and underground chasms created on two floors. A short circuit of caves with a length of 890 meters passes through the columnar part of the cave and ends in the Kůlna cave with an archaeological exhibition. A long circuit  of 1760 meters in length leads through the Słupsk and Šošův parts of the cave and also ends in the Kůlně cave. For visitors with physical disabilities, a large part of the caves has been adapted as barrier-free.
